Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved

Comments_List: 10 to 15 hours.
6 hours
Audit
6 hours a week

The course gave me a brief introduction about statistical methods in genetic and genomic analysis. Though homework was a lot and hard, it made me reflect the questions deeply. I really love this course.
Almost all important topics in RNA data analysis were covered. In each topic, many classic and cutting-edge statistical methods were introduced.
It's very useful.

Strengths are that as an interdisciplinary course it creates a great atmosphere incorporating students of different background to think about the same problem; weaknesses are that in the first few courses students with little biological knowledge might feel a little overwhelming.
Great introduction to the area

A good topic for students who what to study computational biology. The lecture is quit long (2 hrs straight). Maybe consider breaking into sections and that could help students improve learning efficiency. 

Good literature/papers uploaded to the course website.
Many interesting topics. Learn a lot.
He was an excellent instructor. He was brilliant and was able to illustrate the course materials clearly.
Dr. Zhao's teaching is very instructive, and he encourage us to think critically.
Fabulous professor!
Inspiring, and lectures are great.
Dr. Zhao is a great teacher as he is really good at introducing the statistical approaches to biological questions and helping students with different backgrounds understand the problems.
Great at explaining technical knowledge in plain language; very logical and easy to follow

The lectures were really clear and rich in contents. 
Reading materials are useful.

I highly recommend this course to students who want to know more about genetic data analysis, specifically statistical methods. Be prepared with high burden of homework. However, after finishing those homework, you will find yourself learning more.
A very good course for those whose research interest is related to RNA data analysis. Highly recommended.
Yes, I would recommend it, although the workload seems very heavy.

This is a course featuring introductions of the applications of statistical methods to computational biological problems of different topics.
Yes I will recommend it to other students because I think it is helpful if he/she wants to statistically study biological problems.
Highly recommend for anyone who want to work in this area
I will recommend it. Learn a lot about statistical methods in computational biology.
